org.semanticweb.kaon2.api.logic
Interface Formula

All Superinterfaces:
Axiom
All Known Subinterfaces:
ClassicalNegation, Conjunction, DefaultNegation, Disjunction, Equivalence, Exists, FactFormula, FMolecule, Forall, Implication, Literal, Rule
public interface Formula
extends Axiom

Represents a FOL formula. When used as axioms, an open formula \varphi with free variables x_1, ..., x_n will be interpreted as an axiom \forall x_1, ..., x_n : \varphi.

Method Summary
 Formula apply(java.util.Map<Variable,Term> substitution)
          Returns the formula obtained by replacing free variables according to the specified substitution.
 Formula getClassicalComplementNNF()
          Returns the negation-normal form of this formula complemented under classical negation.
 Formula getDefaultComplementNNF()
          Returns the negation-normal form of this formula complemented under default negation.
 java.util.Set<Variable> getFreeVariables()
          Returns the set of free variables of this formula.
 void getFreeVariables(java.util.Set<Variable> freeVariables)
          Adds the free variables of this formula to the supplied set.
 Formula getNNF()
          Returns the negation-normal form of this formula.
 boolean isClosed()
          Returns true if this formula is closed---that is, if it does not have free variables.
 boolean isGround()
          Returns true if this formula is ground---that it, if it does not contain a variable.
 boolean isInNNF()
          Retutns true if this formula is in negation-normal form.

Parameters:

isClosed

boolean isClosed()
Returns true if this formula is closed---that is, if it does not have free variables. Hence, this method returns true if and only if getFreeVariables().isEmpty() returns true; however, this method may be faster.

Returns:
true if this formula is closed

isGround

boolean isGround()
Returns true if this formula is ground---that it, if it does not contain a variable.

Returns:
true if this formula is ground
